     1  package client
     2  
     3  import (
     4  	"context"
     5  	"strings"
     6  	"time"
     7  
     8  	"cosmossdk.io/errors"
     9  	"github.com/bnb-chain/greenfield/sdk/types"
    10  	"github.com/cometbft/cometbft/proto/tendermint/p2p"
    11  	"github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/client/grpc/tmservice"
    12  	sdk "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/types"
    13  	"github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/types/query"
    14  	"github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/types/tx"
    15  	"google.golang.org/grpc"
    16  )
    17  
    18  // Basic interface defines basic functions of greenfield client.
    19  type Basic interface {
    20  	GetNodeInfo(ctx context.Context) (*p2p.DefaultNodeInfo, *tmservice.VersionInfo, error)
    21  
    22  	GetLatestBlockHeight(ctx context.Context) (int64, error)
    23  	GetLatestBlock(ctx context.Context) (*tmservice.Block, error)
    24  	GetSyncing(ctx context.Context) (bool, error)
    25  	GetBlockByHeight(ctx context.Context, height int64) (*tmservice.Block, error)
    26  
    27  	GetValidatorSet(ctx context.Context, request *query.PageRequest) (int64, []*tmservice.Validator, *query.PageResponse, error)
    28  
    29  	WaitForBlockHeight(ctx context.Context, height int64) error
    30  	WaitForTx(ctx context.Context, hash string) (*sdk.TxResponse, error)
    31  	WaitForNBlocks(ctx context.Context, n int64) error
    32  	WaitForNextBlock(ctx context.Context) error
    33  
    34  	SimulateTx(ctx context.Context, msgs []sdk.Msg, txOpt types.TxOption, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.SimulateResponse, error)
    35  	SimulateRawTx(ctx context.Context, txBytes []byte, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.SimulateResponse, error)
    36  	BroadcastTx(ctx context.Context, msgs []sdk.Msg, txOpt types.TxOption, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.BroadcastTxResponse, error)
    37  	BroadcastRawTx(ctx context.Context, txBytes []byte, sync bool) (*sdk.TxResponse, error)
    38  }
    39  
    40  // GetNodeInfo returns the current node info of the greenfield that the client is connected to.
    41  // It takes a context as input and returns a ResultStatus object and an error (if any).
    42  func (c *client) GetNodeInfo(ctx context.Context) (*p2p.DefaultNodeInfo, *tmservice.VersionInfo, error) {
    43  	nodeInfoResponse, err := c.chainClient.TmClient.GetNodeInfo(ctx, &tmservice.GetNodeInfoRequest{})
    44  	if err != nil {
    45  		return nil, nil, err
    46  	}
    47  	return nodeInfoResponse.DefaultNodeInfo, nodeInfoResponse.ApplicationVersion, nil
    48  }
    49  
    50  // BroadcastRawTx broadcasts raw transaction bytes to a Tendermint node.
    51  // It takes a context, transaction bytes, and a sync boolean.
    52  // If sync is true, the transaction is broadcast synchronously.
    53  // If sync is false, the transaction is broadcast asynchronously.
    54  func (c *client) BroadcastRawTx(ctx context.Context, txBytes []byte, sync bool) (*sdk.TxResponse, error) {
    55  	var mode tx.BroadcastMode
    56  	if sync {
    57  		mode = tx.BroadcastMode_BROADCAST_MODE_SYNC
    58  	} else {
    59  		mode = tx.BroadcastMode_BROADCAST_MODE_ASYNC
    60  	}
    61  	broadcastTxResponse, err := c.chainClient.TxClient.BroadcastTx(ctx, &tx.BroadcastTxRequest{TxBytes: txBytes, Mode: mode})
    62  	if err != nil {
    63  		return nil, err
    64  	}
    65  	return broadcastTxResponse.TxResponse, nil
    66  }
    67  
    68  // SimulateRawTx simulates the execution of a raw transaction on the blockchain without broadcasting it to the network.
    69  // It takes a context, transaction bytes, and any additional gRPC call options.
    70  // It returns a SimulateResponse object and an error (if any).
    71  func (c *client) SimulateRawTx(ctx context.Context, txBytes []byte, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.SimulateResponse, error) {
    72  	simulateResponse, err := c.chainClient.TxClient.Simulate(
    73  		ctx,
    74  		&tx.SimulateRequest{
    75  			TxBytes: txBytes,
    76  		},
    77  		opts...,
    78  	)
    79  	if err != nil {
    80  		return nil, err
    81  	}
    82  	return simulateResponse, nil
    83  }
    84  
    85  // GetLatestBlock retrieves the latest block from the chain.
    86  // The function returns a pointer to a Block object and any error that occurred during the operation.
    87  func (c *client) GetLatestBlock(ctx context.Context) (*tmservice.Block, error) {
    88  	resp, err := c.chainClient.TmClient.GetLatestBlock(ctx, &tmservice.GetLatestBlockRequest{})
    89  	if err != nil {
    90  		return nil, err
    91  	}
    92  	return resp.SdkBlock, nil
    93  }
    94  
    95  // GetLatestBlockHeight retrieves the height of the latest block from the chain.
    96  // The function returns the block height and any error that occurred during the operation.
    97  func (c *client) GetLatestBlockHeight(ctx context.Context) (int64, error) {
    98  	resp, err := c.GetLatestBlock(ctx)
    99  	if err != nil {
   100  		return 0, nil
   101  	}
   102  	return resp.Header.Height, nil
   103  }
   104  
   105  // WaitForBlockHeight waits until block height h is committed, or returns an
   106  // error if ctx is canceled.
   107  func (c *client) WaitForBlockHeight(ctx context.Context, h int64) error {
   108  	ticker := time.NewTicker(time.Second)
   109  	defer ticker.Stop()
   110  
   111  	for {
   112  		latestBlockHeight, err := c.GetLatestBlockHeight(ctx)
   113  		if err != nil {
   114  			return err
   115  		}
   116  		if latestBlockHeight >= h {
   117  			return nil
   118  		}
   119  		select {
   120  		case <-ctx.Done():
   121  			return errors.Wrap(ctx.Err(), "timeout exceeded waiting for block")
   122  		case <-ticker.C:
   123  		}
   124  	}
   125  }
   126  
   127  // WaitForNextBlock waits until next block is committed.
   128  // It reads the current block height and then waits for another block to be
   129  // committed, or returns an error if ctx is canceled.
   130  func (c *client) WaitForNextBlock(ctx context.Context) error {
   131  	return c.WaitForNBlocks(ctx, 1)
   132  }
   133  
   134  // WaitForNBlocks reads the current block height and then waits for another n
   135  // blocks to be committed, or returns an error if ctx is canceled.
   136  func (c *client) WaitForNBlocks(ctx context.Context, n int64) error {
   137  	start, err := c.GetLatestBlock(ctx)
   138  	if err != nil {
   139  		return err
   140  	}
   141  	return c.WaitForBlockHeight(ctx, start.Header.Height+n)
   142  }
   143  
   144  // WaitForTx requests the tx from hash, if not found, waits for next block and
   145  // tries again. Returns an error if ctx is canceled.
   146  func (c *client) WaitForTx(ctx context.Context, hash string) (*sdk.TxResponse, error) {
   147  	for {
   148  		txResponse, err := c.chainClient.TxClient.GetTx(ctx, &tx.GetTxRequest{Hash: hash})
   149  		if err != nil {
   150  			if strings.Contains(err.Error(), "not found") {
   151  				// Tx not found, wait for next block and try again
   152  				err := c.WaitForNextBlock(ctx)
   153  				if err != nil {
   154  					return nil, errors.Wrap(err, "waiting for next block")
   155  				}
   156  				continue
   157  			}
   158  			return nil, errors.Wrapf(err, "fetching tx '%s'", hash)
   159  		}
   160  		// Tx found
   161  		return txResponse.TxResponse, nil
   162  	}
   163  }
   164  
   165  // BroadcastTx broadcasts a transaction containing the provided messages to the chain.
   166  // The function returns a pointer to a BroadcastTxResponse and any error that occurred during the operation.
   167  func (c *client) BroadcastTx(ctx context.Context, msgs []sdk.Msg, txOpt types.TxOption, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.BroadcastTxResponse, error) {
   168  	return c.chainClient.BroadcastTx(ctx, msgs, &txOpt, opts...)
   169  }
   170  
   171  // SimulateTx simulates a transaction containing the provided messages on the chain.
   172  // The function returns a pointer to a SimulateResponse and any error that occurred during the operation.
   173  func (c *client) SimulateTx(ctx context.Context, msgs []sdk.Msg, txOpt types.TxOption, opts ...grpc.CallOption) (*tx.SimulateResponse, error) {
   174  	return c.chainClient.SimulateTx(ctx, msgs, &txOpt, opts...)
   175  }
   176  
   177  // GetSyncing retrieves the syncing status of the node. If true, means the node is catching up the latest block.
   178  // The function returns a boolean indicating whether the node is syncing and any error that occurred during the operation.
   179  func (c *client) GetSyncing(ctx context.Context) (bool, error) {
   180  	syncing, err := c.chainClient.GetSyncing(ctx, &tmservice.GetSyncingRequest{})
   181  	if err != nil {
   182  		return false, err
   183  	}
   184  	return syncing.Syncing, nil
   185  }
   186  
   187  // GetBlockByHeight retrieves the block at the given height from the chain.
   188  // The function returns a pointer to a Block object and any error that occurred during the operation.
   189  func (c *client) GetBlockByHeight(ctx context.Context, height int64) (*tmservice.Block, error) {
   190  	blockByHeight, err := c.chainClient.GetBlockByHeight(ctx, &tmservice.GetBlockByHeightRequest{Height: height})
   191  	if err != nil {
   192  		return nil, err
   193  	}
   194  	return blockByHeight.SdkBlock, nil
   195  }
   196  
   197  // GetValidatorSet retrieves the latest validator set from the chain.
   198  // The function returns the block height of the validator set, a slice of Validator objects, a pointer to a PageResponse object, and any error that occurred during the operation.
   199  func (c *client) GetValidatorSet(ctx context.Context, request *query.PageRequest) (int64, []*tmservice.Validator, *query.PageResponse, error) {
   200  	validatorSetResponse, err := c.chainClient.TmClient.GetLatestValidatorSet(ctx, &tmservice.GetLatestValidatorSetRequest{Pagination: request})
   201  	if err != nil {
   202  		return 0, nil, nil, err
   203  	}
   204  	return validatorSetResponse.BlockHeight, validatorSetResponse.Validators, validatorSetResponse.Pagination, nil
   205  }
